## Merging databases

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
install.packages('WHO')
install.packages('countrycode')
library(WHO)
library(countrycode)
library(plyr)
GINI <- WDI(country = 'all', start = '2011', end = '2011', indicator = 'SI.POV.GINI', extra = TRUE)
DEATHS <- read.csv('http://apps.who.int/gho/athena/data/xmart.csv?target=GHO/TOTENV_1,TOTENV_2,TOTENV_5&profile=crosstable&filter=COUNTRY:*;REGION:*;ENVCAUSE:ENVCAUSE000;ENVCAUSE:ENVCAUSE001;ENVCAUSE:ENVCAUSE060;ENVCAUSE:ENVCAUSE151&x-sideaxis=COUNTRY;YEAR&x-topaxis=GHO;ENVCAUSE')
DEATHS <- DEATHS[-c(1), ]
print(class(DEATHS$X))
DEATHS$X <- as.character(DEATHS$X)
names(DEATHS)[names(DEATHS)=="X"] <- "country"
names(DEATHS)[names(DEATHS)=="X.1"] <- "year"
names(DEATHS)[names(DEATHS)=="Deaths.attributable.to.the.environment...."] <- "Percentageofdeaths"
DEATHS$iso3c <- countrycode(DEATHS$country, origin = 'country.name', destination = 'iso3c', warn = TRUE)
names(DEATHS)
DEATHS <- DEATHS[, c('iso3c', 'year', 'Percentageofdeaths')]
GINI <- GINI[, c(')]


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
